<a name="Role"></a>
## type [Role](<https://github.com/Epitech-2nd-Year-Projects/AREA/blob/main/server/internal/domain/user/user.go#L22>)

Role identifies the set of permissions granted to an account

```go
type Role string
```

<a name="RoleMember"></a>

```go
const (
    RoleMember Role = "member"
    RoleAdmin  Role = "admin"
)
```

<a name="Status"></a>
## type [Status](<https://github.com/Epitech-2nd-Year-Projects/AREA/blob/main/server/internal/domain/user/user.go#L12>)

Status represents the lifecycle stage of an account Values mirror the user\_status enum in the database Keep in sync with migrations/000001\_create\_enums\_core.up.sql

```go
type Status string
```

<a name="StatusPending"></a>

```go
const (
    StatusPending   Status = "pending"
    StatusActive    Status = "active"
    StatusSuspended Status = "suspended"
    StatusDeleted   Status = "deleted"
)
```

<a name="User"></a>
## type [User](<https://github.com/Epitech-2nd-Year-Projects/AREA/blob/main/server/internal/domain/user/user.go#L31-L40>)

User models an AREA account holder Business logic should prefer this type over persistence models

```go
type User struct {
    ID           uuid.UUID
    Email        string
    PasswordHash string
    Status       Status
    Role         Role
    CreatedAt    time.Time
    UpdatedAt    time.Time
    LastLoginAt  *time.Time
}
```
